objective: To provide every farmer with a Soil Health Card once every two years.
To strengthen the functioning of Soil Testing Laboratories.
To identify soil fertility issues by following uniform sampling methods across states.
To encourage the use of nutrient management practices that are based on soil test results.
To offer financial support to farmers so they can correct nutrient deficiencies and adopt balanced and integrated nutrient management suited to their cropping patterns.
To train district and state-level officers, along with progressive farmers, so that they can promote the proper use of nutrients at the grassroots level.
how_to_apply: Soil samples are collected from various farms and tested in approved Soil Testing Laboratories (SLT).
The results are then uploaded to the National Soil Health Card portal.
notes: The Soil Health Card Scheme has transformed how farmers think about their land.
